description: In Al Hudaydah, over 40 % people believe that water can not transmit diseases
people pay for water mainly in Lahj and Al Hudaydah
Those having no access to medical facilities also seems to strugle for eating
legendtitle: Are you able to access medical services ?
title: Access to medical services according to the number of meals per adult the day before.

description: Those who received drip irrigation have significantly higher MAHFP scores
xtitle: Did you receive a drip irrigation system?
title: Months of Adequate Household Food Provisioning (MAHFP) and access to irrigation

description: Land cultivators and formal employer also have the lowest FCS Scores which is surprising since formal employer have globally the highest income per member. Howaver, as we can see below this might be because most of them are also unemployed as they say they have no source of Livelihood.
title: FCS Score according to main source of income

description: Land cultivators and formal employer have the lowest level of income per family member
title:
Income per family member
split by income source

description: Those living from livestock have higher level of debt
title: Level of debt per main source of income

description: Those having received husbandry training are more likely to do some sickness prevention for their livestock.
xtitle: What steps do you take to prevent your livestock from getting sick?
legendtitle: Did you receive any training on animal husbandry?
title: Prevention of livestock sickness according to participation to husbandry training

description: In Al Hudaydah people seems to mainly purchase fodder for cattles
WASH beneficiaries are among the most vulnerables according to FCS. This probably shows the good impact of FSL and cash activities
title: FCS Score according to beneficiary type

description: Those with no source of livelihood are particularly vulnerable
title: FCS Score according to main source of income

description: In Lhaj beneficiaries are more vulnerable although most are host.
Those who do not use latrine seems to have lower FCS Scores.
xtitle:
Did you or any other member of your household
use a latrine/toilet the last time you defecated?
title: FCS Score according to use of latrine

description: Male are much more educated than female
title: Education level per gender

description: The way to treat diarrhea can vary very much from one region to another, for instance, in Taiz and Marib people quite often  use traditional medicine while almost never in Lahj and Al udaydah
Debts for weddings seem to be quite important
title: Level and purpose of debt

description: Those having debts for shelter have a higher CSI index
title: CSI index per debt purpose

description: The more people have been displaced the more likely they have higher CSI index
title: CSI index according to number of displacement

description: Surprisingly it seems that those purchasing fodder have  higher CSI index. This is probably because they do not have other choice (availability of land to pasture maybe)
title: CSI index according to how people manage to feed their animals

description: Those with higher CSI index tneds to feed their animal mainly with Maize and Alfalfa
title: CSI index according to main fodders

description: IDPs from Taiz seem particularly vulnerable
title: CSI index according to region of origin

description: Over 90 % of WASH beneficiaries do not think their living condition is adequate
xtitle: Do you believe the living conditions in your settlements are adequate?
title: Feeling to live in adequate conditions according to type of beneficiaries

description: Surprisingly over 80 % of those having received hygiene kits do not believe water can transmit diseases. This tends to show a lack of sensitization after distribution of NFI kits.
legendtitle: Do you think water can transmit diseases?
title: Believe water can transmit disease according to type of assistance received
